member.name: T:Remotion.ObjectBinding.Web.UI.Controls.BocCheckBox
member.summary: This control can be used to display or edit a boolean value (true or false).

remarks.para: The control's can be assigned values and . In case of , a default value is assumed.
The control's supports the .
Place an control on every ASPX page displaying the BocCheckBox.
Provide the external resources for this control. See for details on this subject.
This control does not require or provide a validator.
If and properties are not set, the control is unbound. The property must be accessed programmatically to display the current value.
The control provides a default CSS Class, applied to the top level element: bocCheckBox.
The control supports auto-postback. Use the property to enable this behavior.
The resources required by this control are defined by the enum. See the ResourceIdentifier's documentation for details on localization.

The control supports resource dispatching to its properties through the . Use the following resource identifiers for dispatching strings to the BocCheckBox or use the global resource identifier syntax for setting the resource identifier in the propery.
The control uses the view state to cache the value between postbacks. If the control is data bound, a call to with interim set is required to save the value back into the data source.
Rendering of the control is done by the registered in .

item.description: Renders the disabled checkbox and the optional description according to the 's or value.
Renders the checkbox and the optional description according to the 's current or value. Also activates the client-side script for switching between the values on the client side.

member.name: T:Remotion.ObjectBinding.Web.UI.Controls.BocDateTimeValue
member.summary: This control can be used to display or edit date/time values.

remarks.para: The control's can be assigned values and .
The control's supports the .
Place an control on every ASPX page displaying the BocDateTimeValue.
Provide the external resources for this control. See for details on this subject.
See the method for the validators provided by this control.
If and properties are not set, the control is unbound. In that case, the and properties must be accessed programmatically to display the current value using automatic formatting.
It is also possible to programmatically set , and then assign a value to , leaving set to .
The control uses the view state to cache the value between postbacks. If the control is data bound, a call to with interim set is required to save the value back into the data source.
The control provides a default CSS Class, applied to the top level element: bocDateTimeValue.
The control supports auto-postback. Use the 's property to enable this behavior.
The resources required by this control are defined by the enum. See the ResourceIdentifier's documentation for details on localization.

The control supports resource dispatching to its properties through the . Use the following resource identifiers for dispatching strings to the BocDateTimeValue or use the global resource identifier syntax for setting the resource identifier in the propery.

item.description: Formats the according to the setting of .
Displays no text.
Displays text boxes containing date and time according to the setting of . Sets the inital value of the Text property to the formatted date and time components.
Displays the text boxes containing date and time according to the setting of .

remarks.para: If is and only the date component is changed, the hidden seconds will remain unchanged along with the rest of the time component.
If the time component is not displayed but the date component is changed, the time will be reset to 00:00.

member.summary: This control can be used to display or edit enumeration values.

remarks.para: The control's can be assigned values or .
The control's supports the .
See the method for the validators provided by this control.

If the and the properties are not set, the control is unbound. In that case, the and the properties must be set programmatically. In order to get the value after the user has changed it, must be read.
The must be set in order to get or set the and populate the list of values. In typical scenarios this means not later than the Load phase.
The control provides a default CSS Class, applied to the top level element: bocEnumValue.
The control supports auto-postback. Use the 's property to enable this behavior.
The resources required by this control are defined by the enum. See the ResourceIdentifier's documentation for details on localization.

The control supports resource dispatching to its properties through the . Use the following resource identifiers for dispatching strings to the BocEnumValue or use the global resource identifier syntax for setting the resource identifier in the propery.
The control uses the view state to cache the value between postbacks. If the control is data bound, a call to with interim set is required to save the value back into the data source.
Rendering of the control is done by the registered in .

item.description: Queries the for the , which is then displayed.
Displays no text.
Text is automatically provided by the . Queries the for the , which is then used to select the current item.

description.para: Text is automatically provided by the . The undefined item is selected.
If the control is required, the undefined item is removed, once a valid item is selected.

item.term: Edit Mode / is set to an item not in the list.

description.para: The new item is added to the list and displayed in the .
If is but the control is required, the undefined item is added to the unitl the selection is again changed to a valid item.
If is a disabled enumeration value, it is added to the unitl the selection is again changed to a valid item. When this happens, the disabled item is removed from the .

remarks.para: Initalizing or forcing the control's selected value to a disabled enumeration value causes no validation error. This means that an existing property can retain its value as long as it is not deselected, upon which the disabled value is removed from the list of valid choices. This behaviour mimics the Fabasoft enum behaviour.

member.name: T:Remotion.ObjectBinding.Web.UI.Controls.BocList
member.summary: This control can be used to display and edit a list of instances. The properties of the business objects are displayed in individual columns.

remarks.para: The control's can be assigned an of instances as well as .
The control's supports the .
Place an control on every ASPX page displaying the BocBooleanValue.
Provide the external resources for this control. See for details on this subject.
See the method for the validators provided by this control.
If the property is not set, the control is unbound. The property must be accessed programmatically to display the current value.
The must be set in order to evaluate the of a column. If you do not wish to use databinding (e.g. for a page with a search result), use the as the control's .
The control provides a default CSS Class, applied to the top level element: bocList.
The control does not support auto-postback for the selected value. Auto-postback is only used for commands and the drop down list displaying the .
The control's Enabled flag is not fully supported by the BocList.
If the and flags are set to the list's header row is hidden for an empty list.

Using the property it is possible to define the columns displayed by the BocList. In case you wish to display all properties as provided by the class, you can use the flag to automatically render a column for each property.
The following table lists the available column types.

description.para: Used to display a single value accessed through a . This column supports inline editing of the value as well as a accessible through the rendered value.
You can register an event handler for the command click event with the event source.
Used to display a list of values concatenated by usie of a format string. Each value is accessed through its own . This column supports a accessible through the rendered value string.
You can register an event handler for the command click event with the event source.
Used to display a accessible through a static text and/or an icon.
You can register an event handler for the command click event with the event source.
Used to display predefined commands for switching a row into editing mode and back to read-only mode.
See the Inline Editing section for details.
Used to provide a custom rendering and event handling method for the cell or to render a control in the cell.

If the column is used to render custom HTML code, it can be used to display a list of commands, a command that depends on the state of the rendered in this row or to format the value in a way not supported by the simple or compound columns.
If the column is used to render a control, it can display any control. The only limitation is the usability of the rendered page.
You can register an event handler for the command click event with the event source.
Used to display a in each row.
See the Row Menus section for details.

remarks.para: If the flag is , the BocList displays an icon for each row's in front of the first or . This icon is gotten through the IBusinessObjectWebUIService.GetIcon method. The service is accessed through the of the row's object.
remarks.note: You can access and modify the list of columns before it is used by the BocList by overriding the method. The list of columns contains the columns defined by the collection, the current view and the automatically generated columns if the flag is set.
remarks.para: Using the property it is possible to provide different views for the BocList. Each consists of zero or more columns.

The views can be switched by a drop down box displayed to the right of the list of values. The drop down box can be hidden using the flag. The drop down box is also hidden automatically if only a single view is available or the list is empty and the and flags are set to . Use the property to provide a custom label for drop down box.

The currently selected view can be changed programmatically by using the property. If this property is assigned before the Process Postback Data phase of the page life cycle and the selected view is also changed on the client, the view selected on the client side will take precendence. If the property is assigned during the Postback Event Handling or PreRender phase of the page life cycle, or if the client side value is not changed, the programmatically assigned value will be used.
It is possible to provide each BocList with a maximum . If the number of rows exceeds the page size, it is possible to page through the values one page at a time or move to the first or last page.

The text rendered for the current page information can be set through the property. By setting the flag to , the current page information and the paging buttons are only rendered if more than one page is available.

The BocList supports both a drop down menu whose menu items are only visible while the menu is open, and an in-place (list) menu whose menu items are always visible. Use the and the properties to define the objects available in the respective menus.

The menus are displayed to the right of the list of values. They can be hidden individually using the and properties. The menus are also hidden automatically in case they do not provide a menu item or the list is empty and the and flags are set to .
By using the property, it is possible to hide individual menu items based on their ID. If an ID is seperated by dots, it is possible to specify the ID by entering only the last part of the ID.
You can register an event handler for the click event with the event source.
The following properties allow additonal customization of the options and list menus and the menu section in general: , , , , and .
remarks.note: Override the method to modify the list of menu items and the method to change the menu items' properties (such as their visibility). It is required that the list of menu items remains constant accross the page's life cycles. Only the properties may be modified.
remarks.para: The BocList provides an infrastructure for displaying a in each row. This allows for the creation of row spefic and therefor object specific menu items. Because of the extensive integration into the BocList, this feature is only available when inheriting from the BocList.

In order to use the row menus, the must be set to or . In automatic mode, the BocList will automatically create a menu column. In manual mode, the application developer must add a to the collection of or override the method and provide the programmatically.

Override the method to populate the list of menu items and the method to change the menu items' properties (such as their visibility). It is required that the list of menu items remains constant for a menu item accross the page's life cycles. Only the properties may be modified.
Override the method to handle the click events of the menu items.
In order to prevent the rendering of the menu in a specific row, simply provide no menu items for this row in the method.
remarks.note: Changing the business object of the row with a menu item that is currently executing an event can result in the change of the menu items for that row. To prevent side effects, do not modify the list while handling the event of a row menu item.
remarks.para: The BocList's rows can be sorted by one or more of its columns. Use the flag to enable interactive sorting and the flag to enable sorting by multiple columns. If sorted by multiple columns, the BocList displays the sorting order next to the sorting buttons of the individual columns. You can hide this index by setting the flag to .
If the columns used for sorting include a column from the current view, changing the view will remove the column from the sorting keys.

The sorting order can also be defined programmatically using the method. If the sorting order is set before the Process Postback Data phase of a postback, the postback will override the programmatic settings.

The BocList supports selecting a subset of the currently displayed rows. The selection mode can be set by using the property. You can use the mouse in combination with the control key to select multiple rows or deselect them individually.
The selected rows or objects can be queried using the and methods. A new selection can be made through the and methods.
By setting the property to or , an index is displayed as first column. If selection is also enabled, the index acts as label for the selection check-boxes or radio-buttons.

Through the use of inline editing it is possible to modify the business objects in the individual rows, one row at a time. Inline editing is supported for columns of the type with a univalent . During row edit mode the BocList disables paging, row selection, reordering the list, all the menus and the commands rendered for the columns.
If you use a , you must take care of disabling any commands in this column.
Aside from provding a for automatic management of the inline editing, you can also use the and methods to start and end the row edit mode.
You can query the row row currently being edited through the property. Use the flag to determine whether the BocList is currently in row edit mode.

If you must validate the row being edited, you can call the method. If you use the BocList inside a , the row edit mode validators are integrated into the form grid validation. The validators are also validated if you execute the method or click Save in the row edit mode column.
You can register for the before and after save and change events using the , , , and event sources.

You can add a new business object to the list of values, and start editing immediatly by calling . When a business object is added in this way, canceling inline editing will once again remove the business object from the list. It is the responsibility of the caller to handle the disposing of the discarded business object, for instance by registering for the event.
The following properties allow additonal customization of the details editing mode: , , , and .
remarks.note: If you need to control the creation of the details editing mode controls, you can set the and properties either during initialization of derived list, or during the init phase of the page.
remarks.para: The resources required by this control are defined by the enum. See the ResourceIdentifier's documentation for details on localization.

The control supports resource dispatching to its properties through the . Use the following resource identifiers for dispatching strings to the BocList or use the global resource identifier syntax for setting the resource identifier in the propery.

remarks.para: The control's can be assigned an array of values or .
The control's supports the with set .
Place an control on every ASPX page displaying the BocMultilineTextValue.
Provide the external resources for this control. See for details on this subject.
See the method for the validators provided by this control.
If and properties are not set, the control is unbound. The property must be accessed programmatically to display the current value.
Use the property to get or set an array of strings, or the property to get or set a single string using \r\n as delimiters between lines (array entries).
The control provides a default CSS Class, applied to the top level element: bocMultilineTextValue.
The control supports auto-postback. Use the 's property to enable this behavior.
The resources required by this control are defined by the enum. See the ResourceIdentifier's documentation for details on localization.

The control supports resource dispatching to its properties through the . Use the following resource identifiers for dispatching strings to the BocMultilineTextValue or use the global resource identifier syntax for setting the resource identifier in the propery.
The control uses the view state to cache the value between postbacks. If the control is data bound, a call to with interim set is required to save the value back into the data source.

The control uses a client script provided by to check that the entered text does not exceed the maximum length. This only covers text entered by the keyboard, not through the clipboard. Set to to disable this script.
Rendering of the control is done by the registered in .

member.name: T:Remotion.ObjectBinding.Web.UI.Controls.BocTextValue
member.summary: This control can be used to display or edit values that can be edited in a text box.

remarks.para: The control's can be assigned strings, integers, doubles, as well as date and date/time values or .
The control's supports objects of type , , and .
The resources required by this control are defined by the enum.
Provide the external resources for this control. See for details on this subject.
See the method for the validators provided by this control.
If and properties are not set, the control is unbound. In that case, the and or properties must be accessed programmatically to display the current value using automatic formatting.
It is also possible to programmatically set , and then assign a value to or , leaving set to .
Use the property to get or set values in their native data type, or the property to get or set the string representation.
The control provides a default CSS Class, applied to the top level element: bocTextValue.
The control supports auto-postback. Use the 's property to enable this behavior.
The resources required by this control are defined by the enum. See the ResourceIdentifier's documentation for details on localization.

The control supports resource dispatching to its properties through the . Use the following resource identifiers for dispatching strings to the BocTextValue or use the global resource identifier syntax for setting the resource identifier in the propery.
The control uses the view state to cache the value between postbacks. If the control is data bound, a call to with interim set is required to save the value back into the data source.

If the 's is set to , the control uses a client script provided by to check that the entered text does not exceed the maximum length. This only covers text entered by the keyboard, not through the clipboard. Set to to disable this script.
Rendering of the control is done by the registered in .
